page.title: 08RIVER EXE AT BICKLEIGH
page.content: The{river Exe}is probably the most important feature, geographically speaking, to be found in this block. Of secondary importance is the{river {Dart.}Both flow through steepsided valleys of notable{picturesque beauty. Virtually the only{level ground}lies in the bottom of the Exe Valley. Because of these topographical features, both the{main road and the{disused railway line}from Exeter to Tiverton closely follow the route taken by the river. In summer the rivers are relatively small, but after winter rains, when they are in spate, they result in{flooding}of low-lying fields and parts of the nearby road. The river Exe provides notable{recreation facilities. Canoe {races}are held several times each year.{Angling}for trout and salmon also takes place.
